steps.title: GGG stands for “Good, giving, and game.”
steps.content: GGG stands for “Good, giving, and game.” This slang term means that you’re good in bed, willing to please and spend equal time on your partner, and open to trying new things in the bedroom. [1] X Research source Of course, being “Game” doesn’t mean you’ll do anything. This just means that you’re willing to experiment within reason and with your consent!

steps.title: On Tinder, GGG indicates that you’re looking for hookups.
steps.content: On Tinder, GGG indicates that you’re looking for hookups. When you see GGG on people’s dating profiles or put it on your own, it says that you’re looking for a casual relationship that stays mostly in the bedroom. [2] X Research source For instance, you might put GGG on your profile if you want a one night stand , be friends with benefits, or have a no strings attached arrangement . GGG also means “Good, giving, and game” on dating apps like Tinder, Bumble, and Hinge.

steps.title: GGG means that you’re committed to satisfying your partner.
steps.content: GGG means that you’re committed to satisfying your partner. Being GGG signifies that you’re happy to fulfill your significant other’s intimate needs. This can lead to a healthier and more satisfying romantic relationship! [3] X Research source

steps.title: Dan Savage coined GGG in his advice column called "Savage Love."
steps.content: Dan Savage coined GGG in his advice column called "Savage Love." Savage wrote that being a good romantic partner comes down to being GGG (good, giving, and game) in a 2004 article for his column in The Stranger . [4] X Research source
